016package org.lifstools.jgoslin.domain;
017
018import java.util.EnumMap;
019
020/**
021 * Accounting table for chemical element frequency. This is used to calculate
022 * sum formulas and total masses for a given chemical element distribution, e.g.
023 * in a lipid.
024 *
025 * @author Dominik Kopczynski
026 * @author Nils Hoffmann
027 */
028public final class ElementTable extends EnumMap<Element, Integer> {
029
030    private ElementTable(Class<Element> keyType) {
031        super(keyType);
032    }
033
034    /**
035     * Create a new element table.
036     */
037    public ElementTable() {
038        this(Element.class);
039        Elements.ELEMENT_MASSES.keySet().forEach(e -> {
040            put(e, 0);
041        });
042    }
043
044    /**
045     * Create a new element table from the provided entries.
046     * @param entries the entries
047     * @return a new element table.
048     */
049    public static ElementTable of(Entry<Element, Integer>... entries) {
050        ElementTable et = new ElementTable();
051        for (Entry<Element, Integer> e : entries) {
052            et.put(e.getKey(), e.getValue());
053        }
054        return et;
055    }
056
057    /**
058     * Add all elements and counts to those in this element table.
059     *
060     * @param elements the table to add to this one.
061     */
062    public void add(ElementTable elements) {
063        elements.entrySet().forEach(kv -> {
064            put(kv.getKey(), get(kv.getKey()) + kv.getValue());
065        });
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Add all alements and counts to those in this element table, but use the
070     * count argument to multiply count values in the provided table.
071     *
072     * @param elements
073     * @param multiplier
074     */
075    public void add(ElementTable elements, int multiplier) {
076        elements.entrySet().forEach(kv -> {
077            put(kv.getKey(), get(kv.getKey()) + kv.getValue() * multiplier);
078        });
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * Copy all entries in this element table. The copy will be completely
083     * independent of this instance.
084     *
085     * @return a copy of this element table.
086     */
087    public ElementTable copy() {
088        ElementTable e = new ElementTable();
089        entrySet().forEach(kv -> {
090            e.put(kv.getKey(), kv.getValue());
091        });
092        return e;
093    }
094    
095    /**
096     * Returns the sum formula for all elements in this table.
097     *
098     * @return the sum formula. Returns an empty string if the table is empty.
099     */
100    public String getSumFormula() {
101        StringBuilder ss = new StringBuilder();
102        Elements.ELEMENT_ORDER.stream().map(e -> {
103            if (get(e) > 0) {
104                ss.append(Elements.ELEMENT_SHORTCUT.get(e));
105            }
106            return e;
107        }).filter(e -> (get(e) > 1)).forEachOrdered(e -> {
108            ss.append(get(e));
109        });
110        return ss.toString();
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * Returns the individual total mass for the provided element.
115     *
116     * @param element the element to calculate the total mass for.
117     * @return the total mass for the given element, or 0.
118     */
119    public Double getMass(Element element) {
120        Integer count = getOrDefault(element, 0);
121        return count.doubleValue() * Elements.ELEMENT_MASSES.get(element);
122    }
123
124    /**
125     * Returns the total summed mass per number of elements.
126     *
127     * @return the total summed mass for this element table. Returns 0 if the
128     * table is empty.
129     */
130    public Double getMass() {
131        return keySet().stream().map((key) -> {
132            return getMass(key);
133        }).reduce(0.0d, Double::sum);
134    }
135    
136    /**
137     * Returns the total summed mass per number of elements, corrected for charge counts * electron rest mass.
138     *
139     * @param charge the charge of the molecule
140     * @return the total summed mass for this element table. Returns 0 if the
141     * table is empty.
142     */
143    public Double getChargedMass(int charge) {
144        Double mass = getMass();
145        if (charge != 0) {
146            mass = (mass - charge * Elements.ELECTRON_REST_MASS) / Math.abs(charge);
147        }
148        return mass;
149    }
150}
